24-hour bar. 24 h petrol station.

title: (50191) Juslibol -

Not suitable for very wide vehicles. Lots of mosquitoes and gnats at night so bring repellent or a screen. Please leave the area clean and tidy for others.

title: (50190) Barrio de Cantarranas -
description: 12 minutes from the airport on foot. Can be of service.

title: (50629) Sobradiel -
description:
Small quiet shaded corner on the edge of the river, incredible view of the mountains, you would almost think you were gold diggers given the decor!
you have to go through the village of sobradiel and then take a path that runs along the corn fields.
 beautiful sunset over the river.
we were alone the whole time.
In the early morning visit rabbits and ducks.

title: (50011) Zaragoza - 236 Carretera del Aeropuerto
description: Service area in low-cost gas station Nafte. Well located, new and clean. Emptying of gray and black water. Washing of ACs with bridge.

title_short: (50197) Zaragoza - 8B Ronda del Canal Imperial de Aragon

title: (50011) Barrio de Juslibol - 9089 Diseminado Juslibol el Soto
title_short: (50011) Barrio de Juslibol - 9089 Diseminado Juslibol el Soto
description: You can park on the road. There is a picknick place below with 2 picknick tables. You can also swim here. In the afternoon the road turns in a gay meeting place. So best for evenings and mornings to sleep and chill. The men aren't bad, just looking for sex. So you don't have to feel scared. No electricity or trash place. Beautiful place to stay, perfect if you want to have a morning swim before going on the road again.

title: (50011) Zaragoza - 6 Calle de los Almendros
description: Easy access to the A2, bus stop to the center of Zaragoza nearby.

title: (50191) Juslibol - 20 Calle de Alfocea
description: Entrance to the nature reserve "Galacho de Juslibol", on gravel / dirt road. Quiet, off the road. No prohibition sign or height barrier. Easy maneuver for a converted van, OK for bigger jigs, but can not be PL. Magnificent view of the rocks of the Reserve. No services, water at the Juslibol cemetery a few kilometers away. Ideal for one night. Noisy in the morning from 7:30 (walkers).

title: (50692) -
description: Laundry located in the Valcarce service station. There are also toilets and showers.

title: (50191) Juslibol - 18 Calle de Alfocea
description: Relatively plain, elevated spot, ca. 5x10 meters in size. Beautiful view on the city and farmlands. The last 20m of the way are a little bumpy, but there is another, more accessible spot a little underneath. Almost no mosquitos, thanks to the swallows living in the cliff.

title: (50011) Zaragoza - 318 Camino de Monzalbarba
description: Free public parking, day and night, I don't see any prohibition signs, there is an IONITY charging station for electric vehicles, behind a sports field, lots of neighbors, there isn't shade but the place is not lit so you sleep well at night

title: (50011) Zaragoza - 18D N-232
description: LPG gas station

title: (50191) Juslibol -
description: Location by the river near Zaragoza. We parked our van and took our shower in the middle of nature, a happiness shared with the goats who came to visit us. The sunset was magnificent. Herons, ducks, dragonflies were also invited to the party. For one night close to town it was perfect for us.

title: (50018) Zaragoza - Ronda de Boltaña
description: Quiet road next to the Ebro river. Some noise from the highway, but still not to much. It is a 20 minutes walk from the city. In the evening some cars passing by, but no complaints. No service at all. Maybe this spot is not suitable for big camping cars since they may attract more attention.

title: (50018) Zaragoza - Plaza Fluvi
description: Spectacular area to spend the day and especially if you go with children. Free parking for the night. Green green areas with lots of shade, picnic area and playground. Drinking water sources.

title: (50191) Juslibol - 9054 Diseminado Juslibol
description: Large plateau at the height of Saragossa with breathtaking views of the city in complete calm on one side the city with cathedral view of the other mountain views. 2 nights without problems with motorhome of 7.50m 4m.chemin trailer easily passable. goose paste once past the antenna take straight and turn towards the electric poles

title: (50018) Zaragoza - 2 Paseo de los Puentes

title: (50003) Zaragoza - Salidas Ciudad
description: South Parking Expo. Huge for when other nearby car parks are full.

title: (50018) Zaragoza - 113 Avenida de José Atarés
description: Car park next to the cycle path which leads to the city center. No services. Had quite a few parking spaces compared to all the other car parks we drove past which were all crammed with cars.

title: (50018) Zaragoza - 63 Calle Pablo Ruiz Picasso
description: Very pleasant spacious parking lot in the park. Some shade available. Very quiet place and perfect for parking day and night as never too crowded. You may be fined if  parking with wheels on grass so stay in bay with back overhanging the grass.

Wednesday before Easter there are perhaps 250 vehicles of all sizes in the entire stadium area.

title: (50018) Zaragoza -

title: (50014) Zaragoza - 2 Calle de Ana Laguna

Along the road possibility to park on both sides of the road.
One-way traffic between 8 a.m. and midnight. Quiet night, just the sound of a few cars. 10m from the playground with fountain (closed in February) and 30m from the path along the river.
Sun early in the morning and the rest of the day. 20m to reach the center and the Basilica Del Pilar. Ideal for walking. Bike path along the road. We parked the Van there for 1 night and 1 day and a half without any problem if the passage of cars does not bother you. Several small perpendicular streets are certainly quieter but the ground is often a little sloping.

title: (50630) Alagón -

Nice town to visit and spend the night. good bars with great tapas and traditional food. Next to it there is a small parquet floor for children, with a water fountain where you can collect water with a container, not with the AC. ideal for walking the dog. Next door there is a traditional home-made bakery with a wood-fired oven, all homemade, and on the main street of the town, Panadería Barrios. on the corner a traditional homemade butcher shop and super friendly..

 center of Zaragoza.

title: (50196) La Muela - Unnamed Road

Safe place, very welcoming to everyone and dog friendly. Only 12 kilometres away from city center.

title_short: (50420) Cadrete - 8 Calle Santo Cristo de Cadrete

Urban bus stop on the next street, which takes you to Zaragoza in no time. Ideal for sleeping peacefully. There is a laundry on the same street 50m away and a dog wash. The town itself has nothing to do with it. Very close to the entrance to the highway, so it is ideal for a stop on the way.

title: (50420) María de Huerva -
description: Las Planas viewpoint next to the municipality of Cadrete. NOTICE: AREA OF A LOT OF WIND. Viewpoint with beautiful views of Zaragoza and surroundings from the top of the Cadrete mountains in the middle of the wind farm. It is a practically flat area with plenty of parking space and spectacular views. Full of trails to walk. There is a trash can and acceptable mobile coverage. Access by dirt track and gravel but in fairly good condition most of the way. The beginning is narrower but then it widens. Accessible for any type of vehicle. It is a very windy area most of the year, but it is worth it to spend the day and enjoy the views and the beautiful landscape, or to spend the night if there is no other option. The place is ideal except for the strong wind and the cold in winter. Right at the entrance to the wind farm next to the viewpoint, there are a series of warnings regarding staying near the windmills. It is not prohibited, but it is not recommended to be near them during storms due to the possibility of lightning, and when it is very cold due to falling ice. Staying is at your responsibility.

title: (50162) Villamayor de Gállego -

No hay una zona delimitada para las autocaravanas por lo que se puede estacionar en all la zona asphalte y en el aparcamiento del campo de fútbol.
Between los días 25 y 30 de agosto y el end de semana de la Segunda Pascua (mayo o principios de Junio) se celebran las fiestas patronales y se colocan las atracciones de feria en las inmediaciones del área por lo que puede verse dificultada o impedida el access to misma.

You can also park in the nearby park, with swings, water and shade. We spent a fairly quiet night, although it is a street with a little traffic, at night there is no noise. Also recommended is the gas station at the entrance to the city called GASOLPRICE where you can fill up a deposit at the best price.
